alert.note: Alert for Burleson; Lee (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 9:21PM CDT until April 09 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Davidson Creek near Lyons affecting Washington and Burleson Counties. Middle Yegua Creek near Dime Box affecting Lee and Burleson Counties. For the Davidson Creek...including Lyons...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Middle Yegua Creek near Dime Box. * WHEN...From Friday morning to early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins as water spills into the flood plain in the vicinity of the gage. FM 141 below the confluence with West Yegua Creek is threatened and backwater flooding up West Yegua and Turkey Creeks in Lee County is likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 4.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 11.1 feet late tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.9 feet on 01/22/1993. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (10 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Middle Yegua Creek Dime Box 10.0 4.2 Thu 8 pm CDT 11.1 10.3 7.2 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 930 AM CDT.
